column4: hi, im using wine to run an APP and it ask for "Gecko" ive web searched everywhere and i used APT to search too ... how do i install gecko ? anyone helping ?
its wine-gecko
ok ill search it.. ty
do u think its on synaptics ?
im having troube finding it
its in the repo
sudo apt-cache search wine-gecko      install the wine1.2 version
ok.. however i think ill have to add a new repo, because i dont have any result on "wine-gecko"
its in main repo
well the multiverse, but its standard ubuntu repo
well i found Wine HQ on my software sources.. i selected it ..i dont know if i done rigth, but i think ill be able to find gecko .. just a sec
its installed it itself when its needed it, for me...
i found it.. but i had to add "wine HQ" to the software sources
what apps have you  tryed running with wine ? any game s?

I dont have winehq added and its in ubuntus repos..  ive only tried half-life2,  was a little buggy, like the flashlight didnt actually light anything up, and some textures had lighting issues...apart from that, it ran ok.  tried a few apps like photoshop and collectorz movie collector, work fine
my experience with the wine betas, they break more than they fix
do you think that running a game with a PC with low resources(a game that generaly whouldnt run).. that wine could give me luck?
i got a weak 3d card
if it wont run native in windows dont even bother
ok
did you sayd the wine beta could be worse? or better ?
they are betas..  might be ok for you..
for me, a prog like coverxp is broken with anything past 1.1.33
ok..
